Omodeo & Rota, 1989 : 193
. Bursa Uludaǧ, Trabzon Maçka.

Omodeo & Rota 1991 : 180
. Kütahya , Bilecik 75 km . E of Bursa , Bursa N slope of Uludaǧ, Adapazar ı Akyaz ı, Bolu between Bolu and Mudurnu.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks : The large variation in the position of the spermathecal openings and clitellar organs presented in the paper of Omodeo & Rota 1991 indicates that the specimens examined might belong to different species.

subSubSection.paragraph:
New records:
HNHM Z/11134 8 ex. Erzurum province , Nenehatun. Leg. Szaklóki, 1991.04.13., Z/11139 1 ex. Erzurum province , Kiregli Geçidi. Leg. Besuchet & Löbl & Burckhardt , 1986. 0 7.08
.

Remarks : This is the only report of this Levantine species in Turkey . Unfortunately the incomplete description given prevents us to decide the exact position of this specimen. The epilobous head clearly distinguishes it from the Levantine population of
D. samarigera
. As the specimen reported was not adult and possessed no clitellum, we could not exclude that it belongs to
D. hauseri
which was described from Turkey ( Zicsi 1973 ). This species is very similar to
D. samarigera
and differs from it in the position of the clitellum.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dendrobaena marinae :
Omodeo & Rota 1989 : 186
. Artvin Arhavi, Artvin Cankurtaran pass.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks : Omodeo and Rota (1989) suggested elevating of the subspecies
marinae
to specific rank. According to the diagnostic characters (clitellum on 26­32, tubercles on 30­31, spermathecal openings in setal line d , last pair of hearts in 11) this taxon is in complete agreement with
D. schmidti
therefore classifying them to separate species is unjustifiable.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dendrobaena surbiensis :
Omodeo & Rota 1989 : 186
. Kars Sar ı kam ı Ş, Kars Susuz.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks : The clitellum in the
D. schmidti
species complex is a rather stable character. It lies, except of D. s. tellermanica , on the segments 26­32. The short description of the specimens given indicates a clitellum on 25­32 and devoid of pigmentation. These characters match exactly with those of the subspecies tellermanica .
